Package com.mc.controller

Class BaseAppointmentController

java.lang.Object
com.mc.controller.BaseAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
SharedControllerInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddAppointmentController, ModifyAppointmentController
public abstract class BaseAppointmentController extends Object implements SharedControllerInterface
Abstract base class for appointment controllers, providing common functionality and fields for AddAppointmentController and ModifyAppointmentController. Implements the SharedControllerInterface to support currentUser handling.

    • getTimeComboBox

      protected static javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> getTimeComboBox(int startingHour, int startingMinute, int endingHour, int endingMinute)
      Creates and returns a ComboBox containing LocalTime objects for appointment times. Time slots are incremented by 15 minutes and converted to the user's local time zone.
      Parameters:
      startingHour - the starting hour for the time slots
      startingMinute - the starting minute for the time slots
      endingHour - the ending hour for the time slots
      endingMinute - the ending minute for the time slots
      Returns:
      a ComboBox containing LocalTime objects for appointment times

    • getContactComboBox

      protected static javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> getContactComboBox()
      Creates and returns a ComboBox containing contact names. The contact names are fetched using the JDBCQuery.getContactList() method.
      Returns:
      a ComboBox containing contact names

    • getCustomerIdComboBox

      protected static javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Integer> getCustomerIdComboBox()
      Creates and returns a ComboBox containing customer IDs. The customer IDs are fetched using the JDBCQuery.getCustomerIdList() method.
      Returns:
      a ComboBox containing customer IDs

    • getDateCellFactory

      protected static javafx.util.Callback<javafx.scene.control.DatePicker,javafx.scene.control.DateCell> getDateCellFactory()
      Creates and returns a Callback for a DatePicker that disables past dates. Uses a lambda expression to return a new DateCell with an overridden updateItem method. The lambda expression is used to create a concise and readable implementation of the Callback.call() method, which returns an object of type DateCell. The lambda expression provides this implementation without having to create an inner class or a separate class that implements the Callback interface.
      Returns:
      a Callback for a DatePicker that disables past dates

    • setListeners

      protected void setListeners(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> startTimeComboBox, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> endTimeComboBox, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker startDatePicker, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker endDatePicker)
      Sets various listeners to enforce appointment constraints for the provided ComboBoxes and DatePickers. The constraints include: - ensuring start and end times are within allowed timeframes - enforcing appointment duration limits Lambda Expressions Used: 1) ChangeListener (observable, oldValue, newValue) -> 2) DatePicker.valueProperty().addListener((observable, oldValue, newValue) -> These are both lambda implementations of the changed() method from the ChangeListener interface. Using lambda expressions here allows for a more concise and readable way to define the behavior when the value of the associated DatePicker or ComboBox changes, instead of creating an inner class or a separate class that implements the ChangeListener interface.
      Parameters:
      startTimeComboBox - the ComboBox for the start time
      endTimeComboBox - the ComboBox for the end time
      startDatePicker - the DatePicker for the start date
      endDatePicker - the DatePicker for the end date

    • setLabels

      protected void setLabels(String addMod, javafx.scene.control.Label headerLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label apptIdLbl, javafx.scene.control.Button cancelBtn, javafx.scene.control.Label contactLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label customerIdLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label descriptionLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label endDateLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label endTimeLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label locationLbl, javafx.scene.control.Button saveBtn, javafx.scene.control.Label startDateLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label startTimeLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label titleLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label typeLbl, javafx.scene.control.Label timeZoneMessageLbl, javafx.scene.control.TextField apptIdField)
      Sets the text for various labels, buttons, and fields based on the provided addMod parameter. addMod should be either "add" or "mod" for adding or modifying appointments, respectively.
      Parameters:
      addMod - a String representing the action, either "add" or "mod"
      headerLbl - the header label
      apptIdLbl - the appointment ID label
      cancelBtn - the cancel button
      contactLbl - the contact label
      customerIdLbl - the customer ID label
      descriptionLbl - the description label
      endDateLbl - the end date label
      endTimeLbl - the end time label
      locationLbl - the location label
      saveBtn - the save button
      startDateLbl - the start date label
      startTimeLbl - the start time label
      titleLbl - the title label
      typeLbl - the type label
      timeZoneMessageLbl - the time zone message label
      apptIdField - the appointment ID field

    • validateAppointment

      protected boolean validateAppointment(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Integer> customerIdComboBox, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> contactIdComboBox, javafx.scene.control.TextField titleField, javafx.scene.control.TextField descriptionField, javafx.scene.control.TextField locationField, javafx.scene.control.TextField typeField, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> startTimeComboBox, javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<LocalTime> endTimeComboBox, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker startDatePicker, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker endDatePicker, int appointmentId)
      Validates appointment data before saving. Ensures that no fields are empty, appointment times are within business hours, appointments are in the future, and no appointment overlaps occur.
      Parameters:
      customerIdComboBox - the customer ID ComboBox
      contactIdComboBox - the contact ComboBox
      titleField - the title TextField
      descriptionField - the description TextField
      locationField - the location TextField
      typeField - the type TextField
      startTimeComboBox - the start time ComboBox
      endTimeComboBox - the end time ComboBox
      startDatePicker - the start date DatePicker
      endDatePicker - the end date DatePicker
      appointmentId - the appointment ID
      Returns:
      true if the appointment data is valid, false otherwise
